channel.title: Ggplot2 on Chi-Kuang Yeh/葉啓光

item.title: Example R Markdown Post
item.description: Using R Markdown for Blog Posts This is an example of how to use R Markdown to create blog posts with executable R code. Example Plot Let’s create a simple visualization: # Create some sample data set.seed(123) data <- data.frame( x = 1:100, y = cumsum(rnorm(100)) ) # Create a plot ggplot(data, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_line(color = "steelblue", size = 1) + geom_smooth(method = "loess", se = TRUE) + theme_minimal() + labs(title = "Random Walk with Trend Line", x = "Time", y = "Value") Tables You can also create nice tables:
